intro: Isolona zenkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting to its often-dry environment. It is typically grown as a houseplant due to its preference for indirect light and moist, well-draining soil. Isolona zenkeri is prized for its ornamental value and is popular among plant enthusiasts.
